question: Which of the following statements is incorrect about the Modified Special Incentive Package Scheme (M-SIPS)?
option1: It aims to attract foreign investment for electronics manufacturing
option2: It envisages providing financial support to manufactures in the form of Viability Gap Funding (VGF)
option3: It pushes for net zero imports in electronics by 2020
option4: It is an initiative under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY)
answer: It envisages providing financial support to manufactures in the form of Viability Gap Funding (VGF)
explanation: <u>First statement is correct</u>. The scheme aims to get foreign investment and turn India into an electronics manufacturing hub. <u>Second statement is incorrect</u>. The scheme provides subsidy for capital expenditure - 20% for investments in Special Economic Zones (SEZs) and 25% in non-SEZs. <u>Third statement is correct</u>. One of the major objectives of the scheme is to attain net zero imports in electronics by 2020. <u>Fourth statement is correct</u>. It is an initiative under the Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY). The Modified Special Incentive Package Scheme (M-SIPS) was launched in 2012. Its first phase will end in December, 2018.
